alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 10:23PM CST until January 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Humble...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 49.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gauge. North side turnaround at US 59 begins to flood. Low points on Thelma Road, Aqua Vista Drive, and Riverview Drive begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 48.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 49.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 49.5 feet on 07/05/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 48.7 Tue 9 pm CST 49.2 48.5 47.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1030 AM CST.
